messages.message:
*Important note about secrets in env-local.json*

We currently have a bunch of secret keys for local dev in `env-local.json` that really shouldn't be checked into git. My plan is to make a new `env-local-secrets.yml` file, similar to `env-local-overrides.json` that *will _not_ be checked into git*. I will put the file in 1password; folks should fetch it from there when setting up their environment for the first time. Giving some advance warning that I'm making this change; I'm planning to merge it next week. Lmk if you have questions.

In parallel, working on pre-populating this file in Crafting sandboxes, so that if you use a Crafting sandbox for local dev, then it will magically work :sparkles:

List of secrets I found:

• oidc_client_secret
• stripe_secret_key (note: this is the testing key)
• metronome_api_key (note: this is the testing key)
• session_secret_key
• google_drive_client_secret
• instabase_backend_db_params (contains password for dogfood's DB)
Separately, we should to rotate these keys -- so we don't have an incident similar to the SES one.
Why not use the existing `env-local-overrides.json` file?

```env-local-secrets.yml```
Think we should just use JSON to avoid fragmentation
Because people put their personal settings there.
So, if we want to automatically mount the secrets in crafting sandboxes, it would clobber your personal settings.
